description: Indicates the number of jobs that are scheduled to run in the next measurement period.
Indicates the number of jobs that were started but not completed during the last measurement period.
interpretation: This includes jobs that were started and those still executing during the last measurement period. A very high value could indicate an issue requiring investigation.
troubleshootingSteps: Check system load and job queue length; verify that sufficient resources (CPU, memory) are available; inspect logs for jobs stuck in execution; ensure no deadlocks or blocked processes exist.

description: Indicates the number of jobs that were completed during the last measurement period.
interpretation: This includes jobs that started much earlier but finished execution in the last measurement period.
troubleshootingSteps: If the number seems abnormally low, verify that job scheduler services are active, job configurations are correct, and there are no resource or dependency failures delaying task completion.

description: Indicates the number of jobs that were completed during the last measurement period, but with errors.
interpretation: The error status could be due to permission issues, path issues, or problems during job execution.
troubleshootingSteps: Review job execution logs for specific error messages; check for file permission denials, missing dependencies, or invalid job paths; ensure users or services running the jobs have appropriate privileges.

description: Indicates the maximum time for which the jobs have remained pending.
interpretation: A very high value of this measure could indicate a problem condition.
troubleshootingSteps: Inspect scheduler queue and look for bottlenecks; confirm that job triggers and dependencies are correctly configured; ensure worker nodes or job runners are operational and not overloaded.

description: Indicates the maximum time taken by the jobs for completion.
interpretation: A very high value of this measure could indicate a problem condition.
troubleshootingSteps: Identify the job(s) with the highest completion time; analyze logs to spot long-running tasks; check for performance bottlenecks in I/O, network, or external API calls.

description: Indicates the average time for which jobs have remained pending.
interpretation: A very high value of this measure could indicate a problem condition.
troubleshootingSteps: Check if the scheduler queue length is growing; ensure job concurrency limits are not set too low; verify that pending jobs are not waiting for unavailable resources or dependencies.

description: Indicates the average time taken by the jobs for completion.
interpretation: A very high value of this measure could indicate a problem condition.
troubleshootingSteps: Analyze averages by job type; monitor trends to detect performance degradations; validate if application changes or external system delays increased completion times.

description: Indicates the number of cron jobs that are scheduled, but are yet to start running.
troubleshootingSteps: Verify that the cron service or job scheduler is active; ensure sufficient worker threads or execution slots are available; inspect job trigger conditions and dependencies.
